entry.tran: (人或组织机构)一本正经的，古板的，保守的
entry.def: Stuffy people or institutions are formal and old-fashioned.

example.ex: Why were grown-ups always so stuffy and slow to recognize good ideas?
example.tran: 为什么成年人总是那么一本正经，对好点子反应那么迟缓呢？

example.ex: ...a firm of lawyers in Lincoln's Inn, immensely stuffy and respectable.
example.tran: 林肯律师学院的一个非常古板而体面的律师事务所

entry.tran: 通风不畅的;闷热的;空气不新鲜的
entry.def: If it is stuffy in a place, it is unpleasantly warm and there is not enough fresh air.

example.ex: It was hot and stuffy in the classroom.

entry.def: If you have a stuffy nose, your nose is blocked, usually because you have a cold.

example.ex: Aromatic capsules are great for easing the discomfort of a stuffy nose.
example.tran: 芳香胶囊对缓解鼻塞有奇效。
